website_summaries.verdict: A highly affordable option with a couple of minor design flaws.
pros: Comes with 4 easy to change attachments for a variety of massage needs
User-friendly settings offer multiple levels of intensity
Versatile design can be used on a wide range of problem areas
cons: Some find it difficult to use on hard to reach areas

customer_reviews.title: 2 for 2 duds.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Wahl I ordered. The first one died in a little over 1 month. To send it back to be fixed would have cost almost 1/2 of what I paid for it. THIS second Wahl died the very same day of using it. I had on of those amazing Samsung massagers, it lasted for over one decade. I was so sorry to hear they don't make them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Not to mention this looks like it has already been used
customer_reviews.text: This product came damaged, non functional and missing parts. Not to mention this looks like it has already been used!!! This is certainly not the quality of products that I expect from a multi-million dollar company. How can I get my money back with a no return option?
customer_reviews.author: Jarias

customer_reviews.title: It is poor as a "Deep Tissue" and may work well for ...
customer_reviews.text: For its described "Deep Tissue" massager it failed within a week. Deep tissue means pushing it into your back and massaging those nodes that are knots in you back. I found with sciatica trying to relive some pain that this one and I am sure that others cannot do it due to plastic parts. Wahl back in the day used metal or aluminum for shavers and such which I use. But, again putting medium to hard pressure on my back at the area I needed the whole thing came apart after 7 days of using it on my back after work. It is poor as a "Deep Tissue" and may work well for general use.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba5466

customer_reviews.title: ... months back and I have to say I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this massager a few months back and I have to say I'm very happy with it. I've used this many times (roughly 2-3 times a week, so ~30+ times) and it has held up well. The price and value is great. It has multiple attachments and various speeds, which allow you to have more/less pressure. The nice thing about this one is when you press harder it doesn't stop (other ones get weaker or stop all together when you apply more pressure). It also doesn't vibrate your hand too much. You should give this a try, I think you will like it. Thanks for making a good massager!
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Cheap internal components break during extended use
customer_reviews.text: Product no longer works; broke after 4 uses in 30 days. Unable to return. Manufacture used plastice for a component that needs to be made out of metal due to the impact on the component when you apply for a deep message. I would not recommend unless you want to use for a very light message even then after extended use it will probable fatigue and break.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Constanzo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible deign. Wahl  is normal great. This is not.
customer_reviews.text: Just don’t. This was a waste of money. I thought plug in would provide more power. ...wrong. Also horrible design flaw. The speed control is on the inside of the Handle. It’s a roller know. So when you are managing the back and it his the shoulder it changes the speed. Easy fix more the controller to he outside. I highly recommend NOT purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about 4 months and use it about 2x a week. Still working great. I love this thing more than I was expecting. "Accupoint" head is my favorite and hits the deep knots well. Good cord length too. It's a little heavy for long use, but not really a problem. This didn't effect my rating but in case anyone didn't know (because I didn't know when I bought this): A percussion massager is basically like a jack hammer with vibrations. And it only "jack hammers" when it finds a hard knot/spot or if you apply enough pressure. Definitely good for a deep tissue massage.
customer_reviews.author: sleepyhead

customer_reviews.title: My new boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best I have renamed it my boyfriend I threw away all my other $100 brookstone back massages and neck massages because hey dont compare to this.
customer_reviews.author: Hopefully Helpful

customer_reviews.title: Even my dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Am really happy with this product. It works both on deep tissue, and surface muscle ache. I really liked the adjustable vibration control. Strangely enough, my dog (11 years old) was watching me use this. I tried it on her back legs and she loved it. Now when I take it out she waits for her turn. This product is much easier to hold than previous products that we have had.
customer_reviews.author: This is me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Self Massage
customer_reviews.text: I’m a dog walker at 56 years old (female) who also tries to stay fit with some running and HIIT. Therefore, I do experience tight and knotty muscles here and there. There’s nothing better than sitting down to watch tv and use this massager to work out knots around the supporting muscles of my knees and around my calves, etc. When my kids come for visits, they love using the massager as a nice relaxation tool, as it has different attachments for different needs. I’ve actually purchased this for them as a Christmas gift this past year.
customer_reviews.author: All for Him

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first but now it's not working properly
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but it's been 4 months and it isn't working properly. I rarely use it, so it was a surprise that it's broken. The detachable pieces screw on well, but once you turn on the massager it makes a horrible noise.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Villela

customer_reviews.title: Great value - tenth the price of battery models, but heads should be rubberized
customer_reviews.text: Wayyyy cheaper than a massage. Amazingly effective with a partner. The variable speeds is a nice feature. One odd observation, though. It’s not great on bodies with very low body fat and muscle mass. The provided heads are plastic, so when they hit bone, it makes an atrocious sound which sounds like it hurts, even though it doesn’t. Otherwise, the included attachments - the grundle-puncher, nip-slamma, taint-hammer, and the beaver-reliever - all seem to be quite effective. I only wish they would have made these heads of a forgiving material so when they didn’t hit bone, it didn’t sound like grinding gears on a car.
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This deep tissue massager is unbelievable. I've had tension headaches and migraines for many years, and to help relax my muscles, I periodically get a professional massage. Always the masseuse comments on two neck/shoulder muscles that are always rock hard and painful. The first time I got a massage after using this deep tissue massager several times, the masseuse noticed immediately that the muscles weren't overly tight! The massager, when used daily, eventually helped those muscles relax. I've only had one bad headache since purchasing the machine, and that was a the end of a week that I had not used the massager. This product has been worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great product, BAD delivery system.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we bought. The last one lasted 2+ years, it does have plastic gears inside. However, it is lightweight and helps with our neck and back problems so we are very happy with it. Only one issue...Amazon delivery did not put the boxed product inside an Amazon box! They put the label right on the box itself, which shows **thieves** exactly what product you are receiving! We are Amazon Prime members, I suggest that Amazon looks into this - we don't want this happening again, do we?
customer_reviews.author: True Review

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 2 months (Didn't use too much) and no way to get trouble shooting
customer_reviews.text: After two months of using (I didn't use it too much, just used occasionally and gently used), it suddenly stopped working as my attached video. As I remember, at the first time when I received it, it seems like there was dusts on the product and felt like it's used item but I used it due to extremely stiff neck at that time because it worked anyway. I emailed to the customer service but they don't even reply in 3 weeks. There's no way to get support on the issue. Very disappointing !
customer_reviews.author: Kanghun Lee

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessarily heavy but performs well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought mostly for chronically sore muscles due to fibromyalgia. This does an excellent job. However, I have arthritis and tendonitis and I find this massager is heavy for me to hold for more than a few minutes. So it's a bit of a trade-off: does nice job massaging muscles, which I can't do myself with arthritis, but can't hold it for long due to arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very vigorous vibrations
customer_reviews.text: This thing is crazy powerful. It is cumbersome but you really don't need to use very long. I have neuropathy in my arms/hands and legs/feet and this feels great, especially everywhere. The finger attachment is really nice and it doesn't make too much noise really. I don't know if a very petite person could handle it, just having it on the lowest setting is almost too much. For the money, i think just about everyone should have this model. Have fun you silly folks.
customer_reviews.author: thomas johnson

customer_reviews.title: Ladies, don't use it for THAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a little bit heavy and more percussive than I'd like, but I'm able to get to my back and shoulders, I just keep it on the lowest setting. It's so powerful, I think it would leave bruises if I used full power. There are places on my back and rib muscles where I feel like I have pinched nerves and it helps loosen up those, which is the reason I bought this. Ergonomically, I like the shape of the handle, which makes it feel lighter. One suggestion I have is this: If Wahl could include a little bag to corral the extra attachments, that would be terrific.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Shuffield

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: MRE 2020.05.26: This wand does put out a lot of vibration. The single controller dial adjusts for very light tapping, to major hammering. The long handle makes it easy to reach anywhere on your back. However, the device is heavy and you need to use both hands to make it down into deep tissue. If the deep tissue is on your back, you cannot get both hands back there to press hard enough. Also, I have a well padded bottom (fat buttocks) and even on high pressing with both hands, it doesn't do much for it. Overall it is fine, but if you need deep tissue therapy, this is not the machine to get.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Esposito

customer_reviews.title: It works great but it breaks after a few months of frequent use
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent deep tissue massager that is very effective at loosening tight back muscles. This is my 5th Wahl massager. The only thing bad about it is the plastic piece that connects the unit to the selected attachment breaks after repeated uses. I use this on my patient's back for 20 minutes sometimes two or three times a day, so after a few months I have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: awkwardly short handle and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Whoever thought that hard plastic pieces would provide a comfortable massage, didn't use this product on themselves. The short coupled handle along with heavy total weight made this device very awkward to use. I maybe would have added more stars if they include a soft silicon/rubber piece to make for a less-than-rock-hard massage, would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mears

customer_reviews.title: Great for knots in shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts based of the quality based on other reviews but we have used this for a few weeks now and everything is working great! I get knots in my shoulder blades and they work all the way up to my ears. The pain is enough to knock me off my feet, but this thing pulverized the knots and releases that pain pressure. We purchased this because my hubby’s hands got tired from giving me massages all the time for the knots. This thing saves us time and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Adam braatz

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of surgeries on both of my knees and this massager helps a great deal. My kneed gest stuck form time and with drastic change of weather (or anything weather related around) pain and stiffness kick my behind...So I got his one by my desk and I used it and believe me it really helps. Price is awesome (there very expensive ones out in the market) but this one is perfect and it does not cause bruises on my knee. It is easy to carry. I SUPER recommend it =)
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Both percussion and vibration
customer_reviews.text: The best feature of this percussion + vibration massager is that it comes with multiple heads. The large flat disk is effective for areas where you don't need pinpoint massage - like hamstrings or your back. The pinpoint massage head is great for getting under the shoulder blade. The round head is good general purpose for over clothing- smooth and doesn't grip. The 4-prong fingertip head has grip so must be used on skin (still grips skin so should be used with massage lotion); but it is not effective over clothing as it will not slide.
customer_reviews.author: Amy W

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty ok
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this is that some of the heads actually really hurt and aren't very comfortable to use (we use this on our backs). It is very convenient having such a long cord. My boyfriend likes the small heads because they really gets in his muscles much better than my hands can. It does hurt A LOT if you hit bone with this though. It is a nice product, reasonably priced, and very convenient. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Trigger points
customer_reviews.text: It cannot be beaten for the price. I want something for a trigger points. Even the expensive professional models don't have such a simple but desired attachment of the Wahl Accupressure Tip that works very well. The only issue is that I have been thru 3 in 18 months. With normal use the limited warranty states you can replace it within 2 years of purchase. Now that I finally read the warranty on the latest purchase I will see if it is honored. If it breaks down the customer has to pre pay shipment costs. It has a cord but I dislike waiting for charging. It can become a bit heavy when holding it with my tennis elbow side.
customer_reviews.author: sueshe

customer_reviews.title: Best bank for your buck
customer_reviews.text: It's a little rough at first, you have to get the hang of it just because it's percussion so it taps and vibrates instead of most massagers that vibrate only. It's really great with the interchangeable heads for different parts of the body, I use it on my knees, back, shoulders, even my feet. I bought this because I lift heavy things all day at work and use it on my knees and neck and it helps MASSIVELY. This is a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...for about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.text: Started making a rattling noise 30 seconds after turning it on. Felt great and powerful enough, but the sound kept getting louder until it was unbearable. The case feels cheap in your hand, like the handle area flexes and has gaps between the two pieces of plastic. I assume something came loose or broken inside because the noise sounds and feels like something hitting the case in the head end.. Returned and refunded. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have one of the "high-end" percussion massagers and purchased this Wahl as a backup. I have to say I am quite pleased with the Wahl; it doesn't pound on you quite as hard as my other massager, but that's ok, because it's actually complimentary. The quality is decent, and you get several attachments. I like that it is corded because there will never be any issues with batteries. It does a good job of providing a relaxing percussive massage and I like that the handle is long so that I can reach my mid and lower back. In summary, this is an outstanding value for the price, especially if you purchase the blue model.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: Substantial
customer_reviews.text: Substantial device, delivers good vibrations (Couldn't resist). Found my two favorite head attachments quickly. It is NOT a light unit by any means, but it pounds.
customer_reviews.author: DHY

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, though the design is flawed. The on/off roller switch is on the underside so that when you use it and it drags along your back or skin, the thing turns itself off!! I have to keep a piece of adhesive tape over the roller switch to keep it on while using it. Could be a bit heavier. Like my old Homedics one better.
customer_reviews.author: Bunky

customer_reviews.title: Needs rubber grip and it is very noisy!
customer_reviews.text: It works good bit the handle is extremely slippery if you try to use massage oil. And the speed control is a wheel that you turn with your finger and it has no grips on it so it is very very slippery and hard to adjust the speed. Also, it is extremely noisy. I even tried tightening all of the screws but that thing rattles like crazy. If you can get past the noise and get a good grip on it, then everything else works just fine
customer_reviews.author: Derik

customer_reviews.title: Feels so dang good
customer_reviews.text: Omg!!! This thing relives tension I didn't even know was there! I just got it an hour ago I haven't been this relaxed in years, Started screaming in pleasure when I did my calf muscles with the flat piece. I'm in love! I've purchase so many handheld massagers from Amazon and this one is definitely the best 1 so far and I've bought some expense ones!!! Wahl y'all did dat!!!
customer_reviews.author: KLR

customer_reviews.title: Makes me itch
customer_reviews.text: After having this unit for over a year, I can report that it still functions as it should but hasn't seen much use. The vibrating action of this massager makes me itch like crazy. Guess that's not the product's fault, but the way it is described, made it seem like it did more than just vibrate. The assorted heads are a nice touch but if you close your eyes, they all pretty much feel the same. I'll probably end up giving it to a family member/ friend who isn't bothered by vibration type massage. I can say that the product seems well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Digicabin Family

customer_reviews.title: SENT AN USED ITEM AND NOT A PERCUSSION MASSAGER
customer_reviews.text: The item shipped perfectly. The shipping box was perfectly sealed. Once I opened the package you can tell the item was used before. There are marks all over the device. To make things worse, when I plugged in the machine to make sure it works and guess what? The item advertised as a percussion massager is in fact a VIBRATING massager. Clearly not as advertised and thats, not on the seller. I blame WAHL. What I do blame on the seller is on sending a package that has been clearly used before is BEYOND irresponsible especially considering the CoVid pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Sotonm

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the price. Yes, I agree with another customer the on roller (on/off) should be on top. I experienced the same problem of decreasing power when rolling my back. Two main positives: I love the longer handle. I allows me to reach areas in my back better. And I love the flat disc attachment. As a senior with a more 'frail' body, the flat disc provides a more soothing but effective treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Wong

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Wahl of a fail.
customer_reviews.text: Opening the box the whale massager looks very nice and appears to be well made. Turning the wheel control up/down is easy to control the pulsating head. However, the power turned on, I slightly touched my leg and immediately started rattling around 75db. Turning off/on again will stop the noise until you begin gently massaging my leg again. I made several attempts to provide a video but Amazon will not allow me to attach it in the message fails. Spend the extra money for a quality made product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. St-Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Broke while in use.
customer_reviews.text: Used a few times. Broke using it today. The plastic “piston” part broke off right at the motor connection. So basically junk. Just not built to do iits job.
customer_reviews.author: J Wilson

customer_reviews.title: All around super!
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit! It has great power but does not vibrate my hand and make it itch. I had one once that did , and I couldn't hold it long enough to do any good for my muscles!I. My hand would itch like crazy from the increased blood flow. Lower back and shoulder pain are helped greatly with this massager. I also love the rolling button that controls strengthen of the massage power, as opposed to the usual clicking type. Nice design Wahl...all around.
customer_reviews.author: PSMPARIS

customer_reviews.title: Had to have it!
customer_reviews.text: My best friend got one of these and I had to have one. I was putting it off until I slept badly on my neck and woke up in agony. I ordered one and it came next day. After a few sessions with this powerful beater, I can turn my neck again. It is powerful enough to make my teeth rattle. The attachments are okay, i just use the rounded one as I find the others less optimal. The flat one was good for the top of the shoulders. My husband likes to use it on his feet. No issues with mine, works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: A Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Seems good, but not for people with prev neck injuries
customer_reviews.text: Note- I have permanent spinal damage and whiplash from a vehicle accident so this review is geared towards someone who might have a similar situation. The unit works as intended. I can use on my lower back, but have to be cautious with the speed setting. The wrong speeds and the pounding vibrations travel up my spine and quickly aggravate my neck. I think this will be true for any massager that uses the same mechanical principal. I was hoping to use this on my neck also, but no way. The jarring gives instant headache and neck flare up.
customer_reviews.author: The Lost One

customer_reviews.title: Strong, huge and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had to write a review for this. This massager exceeded everyone one of my expectations. The device is huge!! The handle is long so I can massage my upper neck to lower back with no problem. The oscillation can vary from a very small vibration to a huge one on one dial. My neck and back feel so much better now. My gf’s plantar fasciitis feels better. It’s huge, powerful and easy to use. We also recently got a haircutting kit from Wahl and it was also a great product. I’m buying one for Fathers Day. It’s a great buy. Thanks guys!
customer_reviews.author: Omar Moreno

customer_reviews.title: For people with a lot of knots, get something better
customer_reviews.text: It's ok... Personally, i have a lot of knots in my back and my muscles in general are really tight. For someone like me, this doesn't actually do the job. Sure it feels good, but if anything it's more skin irritation than muscle relief at this point. None of the attachments provide relief for me so now i have a massage wand that barely works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Park

customer_reviews.title: Works well, decent price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with a more expensive battert type massager that did not work or take a charge. This corded one worked well right out of the box. I purchased because of a recent rotator cuff strain, also have had lower back pain and tendonitis. All from lifting weights. This unit allows me to apply it to the upper and lower back, it comes with different attachments, i use the pointed one to apply deep into the joints. I returned the more expensive battery unit the next day.
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: but the machine only produces sounds like it is working but it does not vibrate or ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to relieve pain, but the machine only produces sounds like it is working but it does not vibrate or massage. They do not have a return policy, it is like they know that they are going to rip you off. TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY!! BUY SOMETHING ELSE THAT WILL HELP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I love this
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I love this. my husband bought this for me when i was pregnant and it was so nice for the pain i was in. i use it a lot now even after i had him. my husband has also come to like it you don't need to press hard for a deep massage. the attachments are great, but i found the one i like and use that most!! the handle is great for giving yourself a massage in hard to reach places. but its a bit top heavy so using it on another person for me is a bit harder but my husband has no complaints. it saved his hands
customer_reviews.author: Aangel310

customer_reviews.title: Daily use can cause internal screws to loosen, making it noisy.
customer_reviews.text: My mate and I have physically demanding jobs, and we are both too tired at end of day to massage each other. This thing has saved our marriage! JK We use it nearly constantly, so stuff inside comes loose occasionally and it rattles. But we were able to open it up, tighten the screws, and put it back together...eventually. Putting it back together was the fiddly part, but we succeeded. We love this thing and will buy again when we inevitably wear the current one out.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: get it noowww!!
customer_reviews.text: omg... gameover...if there are any bad reviews, there is definitely something wrong with them! I literally just got this 10 minutes ago and here I am leaving a reviews! my favorite is the 4 finger because it really is closest to the human touch but the percussion speed is perfect and the new flat disk is so easy to move around. me and my mom 24 & 60 are happy customers! I would get this for everyone I know who needs it!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Dial

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: This is worth its weight in gold. I used to pay for at least two massages a month (about $100 each) to soothe my aching muscles from bartending (long 15 hour days on your feet and constant strenuous activity). I honestly prefer this to the actual massages. Now I can have a massage everyday after work and it is heavenly! Ps. That pointed head attachment is where it’s at!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Y.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic part broke on third use.
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this unit. It was powerful and helped reduce my pain. But on the second use it began to make a hammering noise. On the third use it broke completely about 7 weeks after delivery. Not going to pay freight to send it in because after reading the 1 star ratings I am confident it will break again. It appears if you put pressure on the pulsing head while dragging it across your muscles, the plastic stem can't handle the side torque. If your trying to grind out a knot, it's hard to avoid lateral movement. Poor design. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Broke internally in less than a week. Maybe 2 hours total time in use.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed really good at first. I liked the overall function of it. Sadly the build quality leaves something to be desired. I have 2 things on this. First it is made of two parts, these parts flex, and should be more Ridgid. The second is that after a few days, less than a week mine broke inside. I havent taken it appart, but it has an awefull rattle now, and is measurably weaker than when I first got it. I was afraid with the price, but the reviews were good and wahl has a good reputation. Sadly it just doesnt hold up here.
customer_reviews.author: Trecius

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months of lights use
customer_reviews.text: Pile of Junk. 3 months of lights use and the non metal shaft that you screw the heads on to has broken. I now have a $41 pile of junk. Buyer beware. I need to do deep massage and this thing was not up to the task even when it worked. Now it is completely non functional.
customer_reviews.author: A. Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Okay I bought this for my husband since hes a hard working farmer, but let me tell you it feels soooo nice!!! I like that it has different accessories for diff areas on your body. It vibrates with a lot of power(but its adjustable). Wanted a back massager that plugged in rather than needing a charger or batteries. It is on the heavy side, but it helps if your spouse can use it on you rather than reaching behind your back then its easier on you! I bought the asurion protection for it, hopefully it doesnt break on us though. Can't beat the price..great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Grapes

customer_reviews.title: Best $40 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a massager for a while. Several of my friends have theragun type equipment but it seems to all break within a month or two. I've had the same wahl clippers for like 14 years so I trust the brand. Anyway, love it. Strong enough and I like the ability to adjust. I have quite few old knots and this has helped so much to get that stuff out. I see the reviews about it breaking but we will have to see on that. So far about an hour of use and no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Skeby

customer_reviews.title: Not keen on packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I ordered. The first came apart internally the third time I used it. They had a replacement at the door in three days. I had a knot in my lower back and after a couple uses the knot was gone. I like it, but have to verify reliability. Also on both units they arrived in only the original box and on both the tape was cut indicating the box was open. I paid for new not used and an not sure that is what I received.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and it is amazing. I have suffered from severe and chronic back pain and this is able to get deep enough to elevate my pain. It is easy enough to use yourself or for someone to assist you with without hurting there hands. It is also great for your feet after a long day of work. Each different head works well for different pain/massage. It being a corded massager is also nice because it has the power for a deep/powerful massage
customer_reviews.author: Betta C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Both my husband and I use it. He works out and said it works wonders for his muscle pain. And I use it on random spots and love it. It is a bit heavy after golding it for a bit but it works great and get pains that are deep.
customer_reviews.author: Alia Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Works great...until it does not.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool massager with various settings. From May until yesterday (September 17), it worked well. When I turned it on yesterday, it made a high pitched whine, and now only runs on one setting and only on the highest speed. The return window has passed, and it only has a basic 30 day warranty from the manufacturer, that I can find. I will be calling Wahl directly about it and see what are my options. More than likely I will buy a much more expensive model/brand and get a warranty with it. Too bad, I liked this little machine...until I did not.
customer_reviews.author: David Burgreen

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointed. Doesn’t provide true percussion massage, just vibration. I bought to help with neck and upper back pain. I immediately realized this device did not work as described and attempted to return, only to find out its not eligible for returns. That’s surprising considering the number of reviews that say the device breaks easily. I couldn’t find a return policy on the listing. Now I’m stuck with this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: This is planned obsolescence at its finest: just like the other reviews said
customer_reviews.text: It broke after very limited use. This is planned obsolescence at its finest: just like the other reviews said, it has some flimsy parts where they should not be, or at least they should be thicker. Imagine a car engine with a huge crankshaft connected to the connecting rod through a piece of plastic - that is how this is designed. Just charge $5-10 more and make the main part metal. My solution was to take it apart and literally MIG weld the bearing to the motor driveshaft. It should last for a long time now.
customer_reviews.author: MN-Madison-A2-ATX

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks just like the description. Totally digging the handle length. Makes it simple to use on yourself. The attachments are heavy-duty and not cheap like some others. The pronged attachment is wonderful for my back & neck pain. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Broken After First Use... Returns Not Accepted
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars, I would. I received this as a gift about a year ago. While it isn’t the best massager on the market, it still works okay. I decided to give this as a gift for Christmas and just received news that it stopped turning on after they tested it the first time... literally 24 hours after they got the gift. I’m also finding out that returns for this product aren’t allowed... What am I supposed to do with a defective product?
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Been dealing with pain in the top of my feet caused by tight calf muscles for years now. Finally decided to try something other than hot water. This massage works great and has eased a lot of the pain. I should have tried it a long time ago. It is a little bulky for my use. It appears to have been designed more for reaching over your shoulders to your back, but it still does what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Westcliffe Willie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Light duty, but worth a buy.
customer_reviews.text: good product for the price. Bought it because of a back injury and does what it says. the Travel of the percussion is about 1/2 in. or roughly 12mm. Did not like the 4 pronged head it has a rubber coating that sticks to clothes and skin alike the others are a textured plastic. I would like to apply more pressure but due too other reviews I'd advice against pressing down on it just let the weight of the wand do the work. It is rather heavy at the end making user fatigue faster (the wife doesn't like the balance)
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Bought in May - Broke in October
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine when purchased in May. Then a couple of months after purchase, started occasionally hearing a piece of something rattling around inside the body of the massager. Then in October it developed a horrible sound when turned on and became unusable. If you plan to buy this massager, be sure to get the warranty, because good chance you'll need it.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a few weeks then broke.
customer_reviews.text: It was a nice product my husband used it everyday but all of a sudden it started making clicking sounds and after a few days something broke inside it still turns on but something is broken only had it for few weeks. I have to take it apart to see what happen but its Not worth $40 was a good product while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Sweet relief
customer_reviews.text: I was highly considering purchasing a Theragun to alleviate neck tension, but decided to try this first. Very glad I did. The 4 attachments are nice to use of different muscles groups (not a fan of the round piece though). I am super ticklish so I am glad the motor speed can be lowered. I have used it after intense workouts and it usually reduces about 85% of soreness without stretching. I took off one star because I find it to be heavy/bulky and the cord too short. Still an excellent buy for the price and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use...no return policy with company. Pretty sure rebuilt/used
customer_reviews.text: First use the message element broke. Contacted seller for return. No returns allowed...=/ Guessing these are rebuilt/used. Henss the no returns. They are expecting them to break. Amazon was kind enough to issue a credit towards me choosing a new product. the new one is much better and brand new =)
customer_reviews.author: meghan evans

customer_reviews.title: Worms great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I love the different heads that comes with it. It had helped me through my anxiety. When I have a panic attack I massage my shoulders and back and it pulls me out of it. Very very strong vibrations. Ladies or gentle men if you are looking for a personal massage for more than the back, if you know what I mean, I think it is too strong for that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An artist must have!
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I decided to get one! I get shoulder pain all the time from hunching (I know mom I try not too) over my drawing table as well as my arm aches from drawing too much - this helps greatly and I get to rejuvenate all those sore muscles I do wish they had a pamphlet for what motions/tool would be best for common aches - that would be a nice plus!
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: NOT EVEN RETURNABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic - hardly any weight to it. Really have to push it into the muscle to get anything out of it. I wanted to return it but found out AFTER the fact that it’s returnable!!! If I had realized that I wouldn’t have even tried the thing and would’ve bought locally where I could’ve returned it if needed. I will be sticking to my TENS unit as it does a much better job on my paraformis muscle which is the entire reason I wanted to try this. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: T Parkerette

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love this
customer_reviews.text: I love this massager the first one came with something rattling, Amazon sent a nee one the next day amd I love it. I suffer from chronic pain so I use it on my neck, my back and my calf muscles. The 3 prong attatchment is my go to. I literally use this everyday and I am thinking of buying ac2nd one for my mom who has the same condition
customer_reviews.author: darlene burton

customer_reviews.title: Works great, made my wife laugh.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as she regularly has neck and shoulder pain. She just started laughing when I gave it to her for that purpose. It works great and she actually uses it more than the heated neck masager I bought her previously.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for parts.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this thing by mistake. Amazon wanted to charge me the equivalent of about 30% to return it. Then it occurred to me, it has an electric motor and a speed control (that I could use for another project. I can't piece this together for this price. So, to anyone out there wanting a small motor with a speed control, buy this and tear it apart. It ends up being much cheaper than sourcing the parts individually.
customer_reviews.author: RSM61

customer_reviews.title: A reasonably priced massage tool
customer_reviews.text: This was reasonably priced, it has 4 attachments, not sure if it makes any difference as to the results any of them give . Impossible to hold on your own, someone needs to use it on you. There is no control of the massage action it gives. I have a back issue and it does provide some relief. It is what I expected so I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Brown

customer_reviews.title: The Wahl was not as good as the brand name implied
customer_reviews.text: The Wahl was not as good as the brand name implied. I've used other percussion massagers costing less with lower ratings and unrecognizable branding. Compared to others the Wahl felt cheaply made, heated up astonishing quickly and was used 5 times before my 30 day return window closed. I've learned some valuable lessons during the past year with buying items slowly or seldomly used, but priced at a point where lack of a thorough first use being a week or more, then the product used sparingly has cost me more in unused products than my Prime membership.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Ross

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comprehend how this was so highly recommended on here. Absolutely awful, it vibrates so hard my teeth chatter even on the lowest setting. It in no way is relaxing and did nothing to massage my back muscles. Literally just ended up with a headache after five minutes of use. Also cannot be returned. Total waste of money, very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Fibro pressure points massage
customer_reviews.text: I have Fibromyalgia and get such pain in my back and I needed a new massager so I thought I would give this on a try. Oh, I love it. It can target each pressure point and though it hurts like heck, if I can stand the pain the results are so beneficial. I have only used the head that is shown on the photo but it comes with all shown. Nice long handle so I can reach my back myself. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: QueenRobyn

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much better the $200-300 percussion guns are but this little guy works great. I found that it works best if I put on a heating pad a little bit after I workout and then use this thing and it free the muscles right up. Highly recommend if you have issues with tight muscles effecting your body.
customer_reviews.author: Anton W.

customer_reviews.title: Loving this gift!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking at the higher end percussion massagers for my sports-loving son when I saw this recommended and decided it would work perfectly for me, a mom who doesn't play high end sports and can deal with plugging it into the wall. I love it, just the right amount of pressure available and adjustable to soothe aching or kinked muscles from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I generally don’t expect much from manufacturers’ warranties, but they replaced our defective massager without a fuss. We like the product too!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great for frequent muscle tension!
customer_reviews.text: This thing packs a lot of power for such a small size. The long cord is great, so you can relax on the couch even if the nearest outlet isn't so near. The interchangeable heads allow you to get exactly the kind of massage you want. I frequently have bad neck and shoulder tension. After a few minutes massaging my muscles, I feel more relaxed and am able to work out knots on my own. If you have any muscle problems, this is a great option for home and for people on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Nerd alert

customer_reviews.title: Better than the one my therapist has
customer_reviews.text: My Physical Therapist has one he uses on my back and has it for sale. It is $350. I looked on Amazon and found this made by Wahl that is brand name I recognized as making great small personal appliances. This one is easier to use on my own back or legs. The attachments are great for different areas. My husband uses on my back almost daily. Best $$ spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: BeASeagull

customer_reviews.title: Keeps her happy....multiple times a day
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my girlfriend as a gift. The other wand just wasn’t getting her off anymore. This one definitely does the trick. I’m afraid tho that if this one runs its course then the next logical progression will be full on power tools. Like a reciprocating saw with a dildo attachment.
customer_reviews.author: frank pozzi

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at great price - buy it
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, doesn’t feel/sound cheap or poorly built. I’ve only been using it for 4 days already feel 100% better. I purchased this because I am tall with wide shoulders and have a hard time working out knots in my upper back behind my shoulder blades. This product works great not only for reaching those tough areas on your own, but having someone massage them for you with this tool. The deep tissue attachment digs down really well. All of the attachments offer something different - although I will say the wide/flat attachment doesn’t really do much for me. Even if this thing burns out in a year I’ll happily purchase another for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Miles

customer_reviews.title: A MUST BUY!!! A++++
customer_reviews.text: I have used several types in the past that the vibration is so bad it makes your hand itch and you can't use much pressure. You would have to avoid the bone areas or it would really hurt. This one is comfortable to use, easy to hold and it is the best one I've bought so far. My husband loved it as his gift and he now uses it almost daily. Definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy E

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deep tissue relief!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my order today and after using it this evening, I am so thankful I ordered this product. I have tried all of the attachments to help loosen my muscles and tendons after I had peroneal tendon surgery 6 months ago. I have been in physical therapy for almost 2 months and this is going to help my home therapy as well. I also used the handheld massager on my neck and arm. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Christi Wigle

customer_reviews.title: Just fine for four months, then broke
customer_reviews.text: Plastic drive shaft sheared off where it attaches to motor. Oh well. Product was just fine until then (although the wheel power control was a little annoying to turn up all the way). I was mainly using it to massage big leg muscles near the hip, which to be fair is reasonably heavy work; but still, four months is a bit sad. This product would probably last longer for light massage only, but for deep-muscle use it should be treated as a disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Currently in PT for post shoulder surgery. I opted for this model as I did not think I needed a professional model for 100 plus dollars and needing a second person to run it. I love it!! Easy to use, even if I use the weaker arm at this point. More than stronger enough to do the job. Able to work on tough tendons on back of arm. Moved onto back and shoulders, felt great. Great little home model. Worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Wahl sent in a replacement [Broken in 3rd use]
customer_reviews.text: Just as other buyers noticed, the nylon piece inside was improperly designed would not sustain slight side pressure. Mine broken in 3rd use making big cracking noise. Worthless since I have to pay shipping on any warranty service. Also the switch touches body and the intensity setting is very easily altered. Update 8/9: Wahl did reply to my original review, and shipped me a replacement unit which works fine as least for now. Learned not to force sideways. Thanks Wahl for the altitude even the product can be further improved.
customer_reviews.author: Leping

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price!
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked perfectly and still works after a few months of occasional-semi frequent use so I didn’t receive a dud like some of these other reviews. I purchased to help work out some sore muscles and knots, and this did the job! Especially with the different attachments included. Still going strong and definitely worth my 40 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Definitely has power
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It comes with a variety of heads which is nice for different kinds of pain. I like that I can use it to reach the awkward places. I don't have to wait for my husband to come home and help. The balance of weight is both good and bad. Good because holding it increases the strength in my arm; and bad because it is very top heavy. It definitely is a solid machine. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Alright, so my opinion is, if you go to a chiropractor regularly. This is NOT a substitution. However, I've gone less frequently. It helps when my shoulders and neck tighten up. I can use it myself or my fiance will massage me. When my neck tightens up I get severe migraines. I normally get them daily, it's been about every week and a half. Sleeping wrong can get you locked up. It fixed me up pretty good. Took 2 days but I bet if you used the massager and some hot and bio freeze youd be good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Sams

customer_reviews.title: Feels great!
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of knots in my neck and upper trap. My chiropractor suggested I get one of these. It’s really helped to loosen them up and relieve some of the pain. It starts to hurt my hand after using it for a while because it’s heavier than it looks. It would be best if someone could do it FOR me!
customer_reviews.author: EMac69

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: The massager has adjustable speeds, and makes my life much easier giving my husband back and shoulder massages. He sits in a vehicle for work and the roads are fairly bumpy, so he is soar most of the time. It is quite heavy, but that is a good thing, as it aides in applying pressure. I put a few drops of massage oil on his back while using the machine and apply more as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: Clients LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Massage therapist here. I have literally bought 8 of these. I use it every day, all day, on my clients. Mine lasted 4 months before it stopped vibrating. I cant really complained about that since it worked SO well, and I easily put hours a day into it. Those I sold to clients, I have not one person come back and say it stopped working. So, 1 in 8 broke in 4 months due to extreme use. Not the worst .. not the best for quality. As for pain relief... UNMATCHED FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Lords Enforcer

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last, but it was a worthwhile $35
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a pay for what you get product. I was happy with it for the 9 months I had it until it broke. Having to plug it in to use can be an issue at times. It's also easy to bump the intensity setting while in use (very minor issue). The three stars is for the product breaking on me during normal use. The internal piece that connects the massager to the motor just snapped off while I was using it. I won't be buying another one, but I'd recommend this to anyone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: too heavy its feels like an anvil also additional massage items are too hard ...
customer_reviews.text: too heavy its feels like an anvil also additional massage items are too hard for comfort . They screw on and come loose easily after a couple of minutes CREATING A LOUD VIBRATION NOISE. I would avoid purchasing this item under any circumstances. ALSO AMAZON REFUSED AUTHORIZATION FOR ME TO RETURN FOR A REFUND AFTER TWO DAYS OF RECEIVING :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lester E Bulla

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the noise!
customer_reviews.text: Wahl used to make much quieter motors years back but nowadays all the massagers I have purchased have been extremely loud. They are heavier headed and not very powerful at all. I will not being keeping this one I shipped it back. I am not a long time future customer for Wahl anymore since they downgraded so badly on their products.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and works well...
customer_reviews.text: I have had many massagers in my day. I do believe this is probably the best I've had. Some have caught my hair and hurt, some had bulky head's and could not get where I needed them to go well, all were heavier then this. I have arthritis, bursitis, and fibromyalgia. So I'm constantly searching for pain relief. I have not tried the other massage heads yet because I am satisfied with this head. For me a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Wahl Deep Tissue Percussion Massager - Handheld Therapy with Variable Intensity to Relieve Pain in the Back, Neck, Shoulders, Muscles & Legs for Arthritis, Sports, Plantar Fasciitis & Tendinitis
product_meta.description: The Deep-Tissue Percussion Therapeutic Massager relieves pain and fatigue. The variable speed feature allows you to adjust the massage intensity from light to intense. The massager comes with four unique attachments to customize your massage. The unit is corded to provide maximum power. Includes: Massager Head Count (4 Interchangeable Attachments); Massager Type: Percussion; Power Source: Corded & Massager Interchangeable Heads (Deep Muscle Attachment, Four-Finger Flex Attachment, Accupoint Attachment, Raised Bump Attachment)
feature_bullets: Purchase Now – Enjoy all the benefits this handheld variable percussive body massager has to offer; Enjoy the restorative power of deep tissue massage in your home & without the pricey spa appointments
Variable Intensity – Features a variable speed dial for gentle to intense massage; Reduces pain & fatigue from joints, sports injuries, arthritis, muscle knots, stress, & improves flexibility

4 Unique Attachment Heads – Flat disc for extra wide coverage, 4-finger flex to replicate fingers from a massage, acupoint head for pin-point relief of tension, & deep muscle ball to relax the body; Attachments reduce pain & fatigue from joints, injury, muscle knots, & stress

User Friendly – Sleek, long handle for all-over muscle comfort for the back, neck, shoulder, legs, hands, feet, full-body, cellulite, & more; Professional quality & therapeutic to release pressure points, promote circulation, reduce inflammation, muscle soreness, stiffness, chronic pain, & fibromyalgia
Long 9 feet Power Cable – Increased length gives you greater flexibility during usage; Treat yourself to a post work out massage or after a stressful day at work; Batteries Required: No

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
